Title: "Disloyal"

KIEV, UKRAINE – One year after the siege, the Donetsk airport still bore scars of war. Natal’ya stepped out of the car, her heels sinking into the cracked asphalt. She was here to interview the soldiers who held the line when others retreated. Her patriotic escort, Ivan, a tall man with a chiseled jaw and a ceremonial handshake, guided her through the ruins. 

They visited checkpoints where soldiers, young and weary, looked at her with a mix of curiosity and boredom. In between interviews, Ivan told her stories of their bravery, his voice swelling with pride. Natal’ya found herself drawn to his passion, his radiant patriotism. As night fell, the outer perimeter came under mortaring. Natal’ya huddled with the soldiers, feeling the ground shake beneath her. The tension, fear, and camaraderie crackling around her. But the mornings in the war zone held an unforgiving reality. As she prepared to leave, a sniper attack killed two soldiers near their position. Misha had been decapitated, his body alone in the chaos.

Returning to the medic station, she collapsed into sobs. Her cries muffled by military camaraderie—others were grieving too. Yet hers tasted of betrayal. The End.
